### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
 – In step 1288 the lab was connected to the steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5), although its status remains NO_POWER.
• Electricity Group comprising:
 – Existing small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).

  • At (x=-10.5, y=18.5) – placement succeeded but connection failed (step 1283).
  • At (x=-8.5, y=13.5) – placed and connected (step 1286).
• Merged network poles at (x=-17.5, y=13.5) and (x=-17.5, y=16.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network:
 – Group 1: positions (x=-10.5, y=16.5) and (x=-12.5, y=18.5).
 – Group 2: positions (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5).
• Steam Engines:
 – Steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=16.5); serves as the target for lab power and fluid integration (status: NOT_CONNECTED regarding fluid supply).
 – Steam engine at (x=-14.5, y=13.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=13.5).
 – Steam engine at (x=7.5, y=35.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED).

• Fluid System Submodule:

  • Initially placed at (x=-16.0, y=23.5) (step 1292) but, after several repositioning attempts, the Boiler was successfully placed at (x=-14.0, y=19.5) (step 1303). It remains NOT_CONNECTED due to a failed pipe connection to the Steam Engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5).
 – Offshore Pump Attempt:

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Crafting Dependencies:
 – Ensure all sub-ingredients are available and produced via proper methods before initiating compound crafting. For example, verify that iron plates are smelted in a furnace or produced in a crafting machine before attempting to craft pipes.

• Boiler Placement Challenges:
 – Move the player close to the target to avoid placement rejections due to distance limitations.
 – Validate that the intended placement tile is unoccupied and free of terrain obstructions or conflicting objects.
 – Assess terrain suitability to prevent placement attempts in unbuildable areas (such as water or otherwise obstructed terrain).

• Fluid Connection Issues:
 – Confirm that both source and target connection points are unobstructed and within the allowable range for a valid fluid connection.
 – Double-check that neither connection point is blocked by existing entities, ensuring alignment for successful linkage.

• General Placement and Resource Handling:
 – Pre-calculate material requirements and verify resource availability to avoid cascading errors during production and assembly operations.
